Static world¶

A Static World is designed specifically to have a bounds of a fixed size and a camera that doesn’t move at all (no scrolling, rotation, etc)

Because it has a fixed size, there is no camera culling enabled.

Games that use this kind of world include Pacman, Bejeweled and 2048.

Import modules¶

import { StaticWorld } from '@phaserjs/phaser/world';
import { AddChild } from '@phaserjs/phaser/display/';

Create world instance¶

const world = new StaticWorld(scene);

  • World instance will listen 'update', and 'render' events of this scene.

    • Run child.update() for each child game object, in order.

    • Render children game objects, in order.

Add game object to World¶

AddChild(world, gameObject);

Shoutdown¶

world.shutdown();

Clear the display list and reset the camera, but leave everything in place so we can return to this World again at a later stage.

Destroy¶

world.destroy();

Events¶

  • On update, triggered before child.update()

    Events.On(world, 'update', function(delta, time) { }, context);

  • On post update, triggered after child.update()

    Events.On(world, 'postupdate', function(delta, time) { }, context);

  • On shutdown

    Events.On(world, 'worldshutdown', function(world) { }, context);

  • On destroy

    Events.On(world, 'destroy', function(world) { }, context);
